item.title: Remembering the Bonanza Hotel & Casino: A Short, Sweet, & Wild Ride on the Las Vegas Strip
item.description:
A Western Dream Briefly Blooms on the Strip

Before the dazzling mega-resorts, before the choreographed fountains, and even before some of the iconic properties we know today, the Las Vegas Strip was still evolving. A fascinating piece of that evolution was the Bonanza Hotel and Casino, which opened its doors on July 1, 1967, at 3645 South Las Vegas Boulevard. Nestled between the Three Coins and the Galaxy Motel – using them as overflow lodging, showcasing early Strip resourcefulness – the Bonanza attempted to capture the Wild West spirit with a distinct themed design.
